title: English Language Teacher
description:
Job description

**PHD or Master required**

Who are we?

Sister Sophie is one of the top elite training educational institutes in the Toronto area and advocates liberal arts thinking. We integrate advanced education sources in Ontario in order to improve our students’ English language accuracy, critical thinking abilities and overall competitiveness in Canadian society and abroad. Our goal is to guide students toward self-realization, and ultimately to nurture breakthroughs in their learning paths.

Sister Sophie prides itself on its amendment of the BCC (British Columbia Curriculum) & CCSS (Common Core States Standards), which is what we base our lessons from. We believe it to be the best representation of a well-rounded learning experience and means a combination of creative, logical, and observation-based activities, and assignments. We hope students think ‘outside the box’ and challenge their thinking with different methods of communication and a variety of literature. Doing so, will help students achieve academic success for years to come.

Sister Sophie Ltd. is an academic education company with 13 years’ experience which has served more than 1100 students. Sister Sophie is based in the Greater Toronto Area with two campuses, one for the York region and another for Toronto. We advocate liberal arts thinking and currently provide literacy and literature programs to more than 300 students in both Canada and China. We also integrate higher education sources in Ontario in order to improve our students’ English language accuracy, critical thinking and overall abilities for effective participation in Canadian society.

Our history is one of academic success, particularly with respect to our students achievement in reading, writing and their understanding of literature, which we believe is key to their overall learning ability.

We have created a friendly community among our students, parents and teachers. Most students who join us have stayed with us throughout their schooling. An increasing number of students are joining us everyday.

Job Duty:

Sister Sophie Ltd. is seeking an enthusiastic English instructor. You will be teaching English for all grades in 1 v 1 or small group settings at our tutoring Center. We will provide lesson plans and teaching materials.
-Independently design / create English programs for the following subjects/courses:
-Reading Club, and Essay Writing
-Train other teachers in academic development and teaching skills
- Improve /prepare lesson plans
- Teaching/tutoring, including marking homework
- Communicate with parents/students if necessary

Current Teaching Area

[Literature]

· Spectrum (Grade 1-3)
· Reading Club (Grade 5-8)
· 1 on 1 tutoring (K12)

[Literacy]
· Essay Writing

Qualification

PHD or Master required (English Literature Major preferred)

One year teaching experience

Major in English Literature, English Language Art, Education or relevant majors is a must

Teaching experience in elementary schools and IELTS is a plus

Why do you work for us?

Training: Opportunity to study and be trained
Support: Strong teacher & admin. Support

If interested, please send your resume by email to Sister Sophie Ltd.: hr#sistersophie.ca(Replace # to @)

Notes: *****Please send in or upload your resume in PDF

We appreciate all the applicants. But only those who are qualified will be contacted. Thanks.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $25.00-$45.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Night shift
  • On call
  • Weekend availability

Education:

  • Master's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • teaching: 1 year (preferred)
  • english Literature: 1 year (preferred)

title: Supply Teacher
description:
SMLS Supply Teachers

2021-2022 School year

Reports to: Head of Senior School, Head of Middle School and/or Head of Junior School

Education: Bachelor of Education, Ontario College of Teacher Certification

Experience:

Comfort in a Mac based environment

Comfort in a Google based environment

Comfort with virtual learning environment

Experience in an Independent School (an asset)

Working Conditions: School/Office Environment

St. Mildred’s-Lightbourn School

Inspired Girls. Empowered Women. St. Mildred’s-Lightbourn School (SMLS) is recognized as one of the premier independent schools in the country and brings a long history of educational excellence to girls from preschool to university entrance. For well over a century, SMLS has helped develop courageous girls who challenge and change the world.

Role Overview

St. Mildred’s-Lightbourn School has a need for dedicated Supply Teachers to support all areas of our school: Junior, Middle & Senior. This position will be responsible for working in collaboration with the SMLS Teaching Team to deliver innovative and comprehensive programming that meets the learning needs of students.

The successful candidate is enthusiastic, articulate, and a creative teacher who communicates with ease and confidence. You offer a learning community that allows different learners to thrive and prosper. You are comfortable engaging in innovative and diverse programming. You are a critical thinker who demonstrates professionalism, initiative, integrity, and attention to detail.

Key Knowledge, Skills & Experience

We are seeking dynamic and exemplary educators with the following key qualities and a willingness to continue to develop and grow as a professional:

  • Ontario Teacher Certification with Primary, Junior, Intermediate, and/or Senior qualifications
  • Specialize in one or more of the following areas [Middle & Senior School]:
  • French
  • Math
  • Science (Chemistry, Biology, Physics)
  • English
  • Social Studies (History/Geography in Middle School)
  • Physical Education
  • Arts: Music, Visual/Media, Drama
  • 3+ years of teaching experience
  • Experience teaching in an all-girls environment (an asset)
  • Work experience in the independent school environment (an asset)
  • A comfort with Mac & Google Applications (including Google Meets)

SMLS Values
Respect: We welcome and support the diversity of our school community and the broader communities and environment in which we learn, work and live. We respect our Anglican roots and our traditions.

Integrity: Honesty and responsibility are fundamental to everything we do – from the classroom to the boardroom.

Innovation: We are in a place where new ideas and promising practices can be explored, evaluated and flourish.

Commitment: We recognize our responsibilities to each other and to the world, and we will stand by our word and persevere with passion, pride and hard work.

Courage: We are not afraid to confront the uncertainties or difficulties the future may bring. We are resilient and are prepared to be bold and take action.

St. Mildred’s-Lightbourn School is a member of the Ontario Teachers Pension Plan and provides a competitive compensation package for staff members.

If you are interested in joining SMLS and playing an integral role in the development of young women, please apply online at: smls.simplication.com

We appreciate and thank all applicants for your interest in SMLS, however, only those candidates invited for an interview will be contacted.​

SMLS is an equal opportunity employer and we accommodate any needs under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Respect for the dignity and worth of every individual in the workplace is fundamental at SMLS. Our school recognizes the importance of diversity and fosters an inclusive, cohesive, and compassionate culture modeled by faculty, staff, students and parents.

Job Types: Fixed term contract, Casual

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: Interpreter
description:
Job Information


Job Requisition ID: 24803

Ministry: Culture and Status of Women

Location: Fort McMurray

Full or Part-Time: Full-Time

Hours of Work: 36.25 hours per week

Regular/Temporary: Regular

Scope: Open Competition

Closing Date: Open until filled

Classification: Program Services 1

About Us



The Oil Sands Discovery Centre in Fort McMurray is located in the heart of the world's biggest single oil deposit - the Athabasca Oil Sands. The Centre is an educational facility committed to increasing public awareness and knowledge about the oil sands, and fostering a life-long interest in science and technology.

Role

Reporting to the Facility Supervisor, the interpreter will be an important part of the program services team. The position is responsible for providing year-round interpretive, information, and hospitality services at the Oil Sands Discovery Centre. The main duties are to provide information and orientation to visitors at the facility; plan and lead interpretive programs; engage visitors with impromptu talks, demonstrations, and shows; develop and present fun, hands–on interactive programs for children; create and present curriculum-based education programs to school classes visiting the centre; train and coach seasonal interpreters during the summer months, and assist with special events and exhibits.

To excel in this position you will require strong competencies in:

  • Develop self and others: This position is for a leadership role, which involves training, coaching, and mentoring our seasonal interpretive staff. It also requires staying current on complex subject matter regarding oil sands industry, technology, history, and science.
  • Build Collaborative Environments: The successful candidate must demonstrate strong interpersonal skills, be enthusiastic about the Oil Sands Discovery Centre and its content, and comfortable interacting with the public. We are looking for a team player who is creative and has good communication skills.
  • Develop Networks: This position works in a team environment with diverse groups of visitors on a daily basis. It also works with community stakeholders including teachers, parents, and youth group leaders to promote programming and collect feedback regarding program improvements. Regular contact with other museum and science centre staff is necessary in order to stay abreast on current programming and interpretive techniques, trends and best practices. Excellent interpersonal skills are required to productively achieve outcomes.
  • Creative Problem Solving: This position is responsible for creatively developing and delivering programs that integrate a variety of perspectives and engage our visitors with high quality, personalized experiences.

Qualifications

A Post-secondary education in a field related to science, history, education, or museum studies, plus one year experience in interpretation/programming for children, families, and adults in an educational/cultural setting.

Equivalency: Directly related education or experience considered on the basis of:  1 year of education for 1 year of experience; or  1 year of experience for 1 year of education.

APS Competencies

Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process.

This link will assist you with understanding competencies:

Below is a list of the APS Competencies to assist you:

  • Agility
  • Drive for Results
  • Develop Self and Others
  • Build Collaborative Environments
  • Develop Networks
  • Systems Thinking
  • Creative Problem Solving

Salary

$2106.93-$2738.86 bi-weekly ( $54,990 - $71,484 per year)

Notes

This is a regular permanent position with 36.25 hours per week. The schedule of the position includes regular evening and weekend shifts.

Final candidates will be required to undergo a security screening. Due to wait times to receive a completed Criminal Records Check (CRC) that includes Vulnerable Sector screening check, applicants that are invited for an interview are encouraged to request a completed CRC (level 1) that includes Vulnerable Sector screening check from their local RCMP/Police detachment prior to their interview. The CRC will only need to be provided upon request. A valid First Aid and CPR is an asset.

The successful candidate may be eligible for an attraction bonus as well as the Fort McMurray Allowance.

In order to accurately reflect your related experience/education, in your resume, please include dates (including months and years) associated with all education and work experience.

  • For employment: Please indicate whether your work experience is casual, part-time or full-time. Example: Receptionist, Jan 2018 - June 2021, Part-time (three 8 hr shifts/week).
  • For any Post-Secondary Education: Please specify your major and length of program, the educational institution, and the year you graduated.


Examples:

  • Bachelor of Arts, major in Psychology, University of Alberta, 2009
  • Social Work Diploma (1 year), Campbell College, 2017


Optional: Links and information on what the GoA has to offer to prospective employees.

  • Working for the Alberta Public Service –
  • Pension plans:
    • Public Service Pension Plan (PSPP) –
    • Management Employees Pension Plan (MEPP) –
  • Leadership and mentorship program
  • Professional learning and development
  • Positive workplace culture and work-life balance

How To Apply



If you are not currently an employee with the Government of Alberta, the first step in applying for a job is creating your candidate profile within our online application system,

Existing employees should access the Career tile in 1GX to submit their application in order to be recognized as an internal applicant.

Once you have created your candidate profile, visit the Alberta Public Service job site to apply for jobs at

Applicants are advised to provide information that clearly and concisely demonstrates how their qualifications meet the advertised requirements, including education, experience and relevant examples of required competencies.

Resources for applicants:



It is recommended that applicants who have obtained educational credentials from outside of Canada and have not had them previously assessed, obtain an evaluation of their credentials from the International Qualifications Assessment Service (IQAS)

Closing Statement

This competition may be used to fill future vacancies, across the Government of Alberta, at the same or lower classification level.

We thank all applicants for their interest. All applications will be reviewed to determine which candidates' qualifications most closely match the advertised requirements. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

If you require any further information on this job posting or a copy of the role profile, and/or require a disability related accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact, TAS Administrator Shannon Nadeau at Shannon.Nadeau@gov.ab.ca.

If this competition is closed as per the closing date noted above, please continue to check

title: newPart-time High School Music Teacher
description:
Job Description

McCanny Secondary School is a whole year-round private school inspected by the Ontario Ministry of Education and granted Ontario Secondary School Diploma credits to Grades 9– 12 students each year. Our students learn to be passionate, dedicated, and eager to achieve understanding in every course. From university English to math, history, art programs, and dance classes, our students can express themselves while gaining the optimal knowledge for their future studies. A school dedicated to preparing students for post-secondary prestigious studies.

We are looking for an experienced Music Teacher to join our team.

You will work with students from G9 to G12 in smaller groups, plan lessons based on the Ontario English curriculum, and take on responsibilities for students’ development.

Below are some of the responsibilities are expected to undertake:

  • Good communication skills
  • Desire to help students achieve their academic goals
  • Monitoring students’ learning progress
  • Adapting the lessons to suit the students’ needs
  • Providing direct and honest feedback at pupils’ request
  • Charting the growth of pupils’ skills and capabilities until they have achieved mastery of the instrument
  • Teaching pupils about the theory of music
  • Instructing pupils in essential skills, such as reading sheet music
  • Provide a minimum of two (2) live feedback sessions per week
  • Develop lesson and action plans to aid students in their learning activities

Job Qualifications and Skill Sets:

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in a music-related field
  • OCT preferred
  • Ability to play the guitar or other musical instruments
  • Ability to teach another person how to play the guitar
  • Reliable interpersonal skills for one-on-one music lessons
  • Deep understanding of music theory, music education, and general music
  • Functional knowledge of sheet music composition
  • Appropriate communication skills for high schools, or accredited colleges

Working hours:

Monday 1:00pm-4:00pm

Wednesday 9:00am-11:45am

Thursday 9:00am-11:45am

Job Type:

Part-time

Salary:

To be discussed

We are looking for your most recent and awe-inspiring projects to evaluate your skills properly. An ideal portfolio is diverse and provides a quick overview of your accomplishments and abilities. It should also retain credibility with reviews and references in addition to your work.

Job Type: Part-time

Salary: $25.00-$30.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Experience:

  • teaching: 1 year (preferred)

title: newTeacher
description:
We currently have opportunities for full or part time instructors for the 2022-2023 school year. We are seeking teachers who are truly passionate about connecting with children and who can comfortably do so using a variety of approaches to teaching and learning. Our ideal candidate would have the motivation, background and experience to develop lessons which offer holistic, blended instruction in subjects such as science, history, math, theatre, visual arts, language, outdoor studies or geography, without relying on mandated or pre-set curriculums. Teachers are given the opportunity to develop the curriculum on an on-going basis based on the needs, interests and questions of the children in their classrooms. Teachers are also expected to cultivate caring and responsive relationships with their students and with the class as a whole.

Ideal candidates would possess a Bachelor of Education or an equivalent in terms of experience and/or training working with children and youth; have demonstrated experience working with children or youth in alternative educational settings and contexts; possess an ability to be open, flexible and think outside of conventional practices and approaches; be ready to support students in a truly holistic way whereby the emotional development and cognitive development of the students is given equal attention and importance; have the ability to develop creative, engaging, and meaningful curricula on an on-going basis and in response to their students; have a familiarity with and ability to implement inquiry-based learning techniques; be willing to respond to and engage with students as a pathway for developing curriculum; enthusiastically facilitate outdoor opportunities and activities on a daily basis; possess and be able to model an exceptional personal level of excellence, integrity, drive and passion for life and learning, both inside and outside the classroom.

This is a perfect position for someone who is committed to creating and participating in alternative educational opportunities and practices, and who possesses the vision and drive to develop and implement such a program alongside an invested, supportive group of coordinators, parents, and their children. If you are looking for the unique and profound opportunity to positively impact and build up a grass-roots, non-profit, truly alternative school in Ottawa, we would love to hear from you.
​
Please contact us with a letter of introduction and CV by May 20th, 2022. Interviews will follow for qualified candidates. Position to begin September 2022 until June 2023. Rate of pay $27 to $35 per hour. For more information about our programming, please visit our website at www.bluewhalechildrenscentre.ca​

Job Type: Fixed term contract
Contract length: 10 months

Salary: $25.00-$30.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • teaching: 1 year (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-20
Expected start date: 2022-09-05

title: newLanguage Teacher (English/French)
description:
Jade College is a leading provider of language training and professional programs in Montreal. We are committed to hiring and retaining energetic, positive and skilled teachers who can make a difference in serving the educational needs of our students. We are currently looking for teachers and tutors in various domains such as French, English, Math, Science, History, etc.

Roles include:

Plan and implement learning lessons for students through activities

Engage meaningfully with students to support their cognitive and social development

Maintain, clean and organize an inspirational learning environment

Assess the abilities, interests and needs of students and discuss progress or problems with other staff members

Classes can vary from private to small groups (1 to 15) depending on the subject of study and demand.

Students are grouped according to age and level, they range from 5 years old to adults.

Experience in tutoring or teaching is an advantage but not required.

Hours are flexible and based on demand in the subject.

Salary is determined based on experience and education. (Range 15-30$ an hour)

No phone calls please. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $15.00-$30.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Flexible schedule
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Night shift

COVID-19 considerations:
We are taking COVID-19 precautions seriously which is why most of the classes are given online. We wear masks and sanitize our offices.

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

title: newEdmonton, Canada Part-Time LSAT Tutor (Manhattan Elite Prep)
description:
Manhattan Elite Prep is a multi-national educational services firm with over 10 years of experiences in the test prep, admissions consulting and career training industry. Since the inception, we have grown into a multi-national firm, focusing on helping students achieve the highest GMAT, GRE, TOEFL, SAT, ACT, LSAT & MCAT scores with the least amount of time and financial investments. Additionally, we offer assistance with college, business and graduate school admissions consulting, application advisory and essay editing services.

We also offer private tutoring for all K-12 academic subjects including math, English, history and more. For more information, please visit https://www.manhattaneliteprep.com.

Job Description:

Test subject needed: SAT

We are looking for experienced LSAT test prep teachers and/or tutors who have a strong interest in guiding local students and can engage students on all levels.
The best fit will be someone who has taken the same test(s), has experience of teaching the tests, has strong professional ethics, is co-operative with the company's management and administrative staff, enjoys teaching, has flexible schedule for evenings and weekends, and enjoys being part of a growing company and making meaningful contributions. Admissions Consulting experience such as essay review also preferred.
Qualifications:

-Based in the city of Edmonton (or within short travel distance)

-Top official (non-mock) test score (please attach original report); Other official test score reports if available. If official test score is not available, mock test scores will be considered

-A track record of excellent teaching and/or tutoring experience for the same test or similar test

-A degree from a recognized college or post-graduate program preferred, All Ph.D. candidates or graduates welcome

-Flexible with providing different services in teaching, tutoring, and consulting

-High proficiency & fluency in English desired

-Solid computer skills

-Your application must include the following:

-Official or mock test scores with test dates (Not required for TOEFL/IELTS)
-Cover letter or email detailing prior teaching experience
-Resume
*PLEASE NOTE: In any response please use the following as an example for your email subject line: LSAT INSTRUCTOR - Edmonton, Canada - XXX (APPLICANT'S FULL NAME) -LSAT SCORE: XXX

If you do not format your subject line according to the above example, your candidacy will not be considered. Thank you again for your time.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $25.00-$30.00 per hour

title: Elementary 1-6 Teacher Replacement 100%
description:
Job Code: 3195032
Closing Date: Ongoing

Employer: Western Québec School Board
Posted on: Apr 26, 2022

Job Type:

Full Time
Contract / term

Job Category:

Teachers, Principals & Superintendents



Openings: 1



Mandatory Document:

Resume
Cover Letter



School:

Namur Intermediate School (Namur)




Start Date: Apr 11, 2022

End Date: June 29, 2022

Salary:

Employment Opportunity:

Elementary 1-6 Teacher - Replacement 100%

Namur Intermediate School

Who We Are:

An English school board that is dedicated to developing lifelong learners who contribute to society and are prepared for their future. Teachers and staff are committed to academic excellence and the provision of quality education, which encourages social, emotional and moral development.

Key Responsibilities:

  • prepare and present courses and provide developmental and cognitive learning activities within the guidelines of the authorized programs;
  • work together with the other teachers and the personnel of the school in order to take the appropriate measures to meet the individual needs of students;
  • organize and supervise student activities;
  • provide support and remediation;
  • supervise students for whom he or she is responsible as well as other students in his or her presence;
  • evaluate the performance and progress of students for whom he or she is responsible and to report on them to the school administration and to parents according to the system in effect;
  • monitor the late arrivals and absences of his or her students and to report them to the school administration according to the system in effect;
  • participate in meetings relating to his or her work;
  • perform other duties usually assigned to teaching personnel;
  • choose the appropriate method to prepare and present his or her courses within the guidelines of the authorized programs;
  • take the necessary measures to enable him or her to attain and maintain a high level of professional competency in keeping with the Education Act;
  • provide learning and developmental activities to students and shall participate in the development of student life in the school.

Qualification Requirements:

  • Applicants must hold a "Brevet d'enseignement" or a teaching permit from the province of Quebec or from a Canadian province;
  • Teaching experience is considered an asset.

Application must include:

  • Resume (including detailed work history and education background)
  • A cover letter
  • Professional references
  • A valid security background check (if you possess one)
  • Please ensure your profile with Apply to Education is up to date.

Skills & Competencies:

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to adapt to a variety of student needs
  • Superior organizational skills

Work Conditions:
Start Date: April 11, 2022
End Date: June 29, 2022

APPLICATIONS MUST BE SUBMITTED THROUGH APPLYTOEDUCATION

https://westernquebec.ca/resources/careers/

Only those candidates chosen for interviews will be contacted.

The Western Quebec School Board is committed to building an educational community with the common purpose to realize the potential of all our students by cultivating a strong corps of support, professional, teaching and administrative excellence. We therefore encourage applications from Indigenous people, as well as from other racialized people groups, persons living with a disability, people of religious faith, and gender minorities.

As an organization, we strive to hire individuals who reflect the communities we serve, and who embody and practice a love of life-long learning, teamwork, and the highest professional ethics. Our efforts to achieve a diverse workforce that contributes to a culturally safe working environment include establishing proactive employment practices to address systemic barriers and removing obstacles to hiring and retaining qualified people.


The Western Québec School Board is required to implement Bill21

http://www.assnat.qc.ca/en/travaux-parlementaires/projets-loi/projet-loi-21-42-1.html

The Act respecting the laicity of the State (hereinafter the Act) has created an obligation for certain public organizations, including school boards, to ensure that religious symbols are not worn by specific employees while exercising their functions. The Act specifies that it is incumbent upon the Director General to take the necessary measures to ensure compliance with this new obligation.

The purpose of this Directive is to present the main obligations stemming from the Act and to guide
management personnel in the implementation of any required measure, while respecting, as much as
possible, the values of inclusion, integrity and respect as espoused by the Western Québec School Board.

The Act respecting the laicity of the State
Prohibition regarding the wearing of religious symbols
Principals, vice principals, centre directors, assistant centre directors, and teachers are prohibited from wearing religious symbols in the exercise of their functions.

title: Casual Instructor, Nunavut Teacher Education Program (NTEP)
description:
Community:
Across Nunavut
Reference number:
051-2021-INNTEPC
Type of employment:
Casual
Union Status:
This position is included in the Nunavut Employees Union
Salary:
$95,882 to $108,810
Northern Allowance:
Varies based on community

Housing: Housing may be available.

Our intention with this process is to create a qualified pool of applicants to staff current and future Instructor, Nunavut Teacher Education Program (NTEP) vacancies across Nunavut’s communities. Positions are available or will become available in multiple locations. Please specify in your cover letter your location of preference.

Reporting to the Manager, Teacher Education Program (TEP), the incumbent is responsible for the development, delivery and evaluation of courses and programs for the student teachers registered in the College’s Teacher Education initiatives as assigned by the Manager. Program delivery may be at either a Nunavut Arctic College Campus or at various field locations throughout Nunavut.

The Nunavut Teacher Education Program is offered in partnership with the Faculty of Education at Memorial University of Newfoundland. The position contributes towards the Nunavut Teacher Education Program’s objective to graduate culturally competent and bilingual teachers. Where possible, College faculty will be bilingual in Inuktut and English. The incumbent in the position will transmit content knowledge and teaching methods in the chosen areas of specialties.

The incumbent will develop and deliver instruction as required to meet learner needs and the standards established by the partner University by preparing course syllabi; delivering lessons using a variety of instructional strategies, including face-to-face, blended, and/or online; recommending curriculum revisions; researching, reviewing and recommending resource materials to implement or enhance the program or courses; maintaining a record of all course outlines and material used in course/program delivery; developing and administering materials for learner evaluation; assessing learners’ performance of skills; and travelling to other communities for course delivery when required.

The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor of Education degree or an undergraduate degree in a field appropriate to program offerings, plus a Master of Education degree or a Master or Doctoral degree in a field appropriate to the NTEP offerings. The candidate will also require a minimum of five (5) years teaching experience, three (3) years of which must be teaching grades within Kindergarten to Grade Twelve, training and/or experience in online instruction.

Instructional experience in adult education and or experience in teacher education as well as the ability to speak more than one of Nunavut’s official languages are considered assets. Candidates with education and experience in the following concentrations are preferred: Arts and Music Education, Assessment in Education, Curriculum and Instruction, Educational Administration, Educational Psychology, Educational Research, English, Environmental Education, Indigenous Education, Indigenous History, Inuit Art, Language and Literacy Education, Language Arts, Math Education, Mathematics, Online and Distance teaching and learning, Physical Education, Psychology, Science Education, Social Justice Education, Social Studies, Sociology, Special Education, STEM Education, and Theory and Practice in Elementary Education.


If you are interested in applying for this job, please email your cover letter and resume to nachr@arcticcollege.com. Please include the REFERENCE # in the subject line of your email.

  • The Government of Nunavut is committed to creating a more representative workforce so it can better understand and serve the needs of Nunavummiut. Priority will be given to Nunavut Inuit. Candidates must clearly identify their eligibility in order to receive priority consideration under the Nunavut Priority Hiring Policy.
  • Employment in some positions requires an acceptable criminal record check. Possession of a criminal record will not necessarily disqualify candidates from further consideration.
  • Applicants may submit their resume in the Official Language of their choice.
  • Eligibility list may be created to fill future vacancies.
  • Job descriptions may be obtained by fax, email or on the website.
  • Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Contact:

Nunavut Arctic College (Iqaluit)

Manager of Human Resources Nunavut Arctic College
P.O. Box 600
Iqaluit, Nunavut X0A 0H0
Phone: 867-979-7231
Fax: 867-979-7108
Email: nachr@arcticcollege.com
www.arcticcollege.ca

title: Teacher - Division 2
description:
Teacher – Division 2

Education Department


ABOUT FORT MCKAY

The Fort McKay First Nation (FMFN) is composed of over 800 band members, including those of Cree and Dene heritage, with approximately 400 members residing in the hamlet of Fort McKay — a community located approximately 65 km north of Fort McMurray. Fort McKay offers the best of both worlds: remote northern life for the nature lover and proximity to a large city of about 70,000 people with all the amenities you need.

ABOUT THE NEW SCHOOL - Opening Fall of 2022 - Come Join the Team!

The Fort McKay First Nation is nearing completion of its Brand-New K-9 school located in the community of Fort McKay. The Elsie Fabian School will be opening its doors September of 2022 and we are looking for dynamic and passionate Educators who love Northern Living to join the team! The school will incorporate both the Dene and Cree Language, culture, and Land-Based Education where students will learn about their rich local history. Fort McKay is looking for talented educators who practice and believe that the well-being of the child is at the center of everything; this is the shared practice and belief of the Fort McKay elders, parents and community members.

The foundation of the Elsie Fabian School is engagement in teaching and learning, parents and community, culture and traditions, and a school environment based on the principles of love, responsibility, respect, listening, nurturing, relationships, humility and learning. Join us and be apart of the Fort McKay community - a Nation that is committed to advancing quality education for all First Nations learners by connecting to land and honouring our languages.

ABOUT THE ROLE

We are seeking passionate Teachers who are looking for an enriching experience and to be part of the new school team. Teachers will be responsible for supporting and developing Fort McKay students, while focusing on the delivery of exceptional educational services. This is a full-time position reporting directly to the Principal of Elsie Fabian School. The operation hours will be Monday to Friday 8:00am to 4:00pm.


KEY RESPONSIBITIES

Primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Lead instruction and provide quality teaching, ongoing analysis, pedagogical knowledge and make decisions that support optimum learning for all students.
  • Work in a collaborative setting to reach the schools goal of providing a strong Cree Language, Dene Language, Land-Based Learning and Academic Program with a focus on literacy and numeracy.
  • Design and implement individual program plans.
  • Apply the Alberta Teaching quality standards.

KEY REQUIREMENTS

  • Possess a Bachelor of Education
  • Holds a valid Alberta Teacher’s Certificate
  • Ability to use technology in the classroom to engage student learning
  • Ability and commitment to work as a member of a team and establish productive relationships with staff and parents
  • Knowledge of the curriculum and teaching experience in division 2
  • Knowledge of the Alberta Elementary Curriculum
  • Superior organizational and interpersonal skills
  • Demonstrated ability creating a classroom characterized by inclusion, equity and differentiated instruction
  • Experience working in a First Nations community including knowledge of First Nations culture, traditions and values is a definite asset
  • Ability to speak, read and write Cree and/or Dene considered an asset
  • Clean Criminal Record Check with vulnerable sector required
  • Valid class 5 Driver’s License & Clean Driver’s Abstract required
  • Successful candidate will be required to live in (or relocate to) Fort McMurray, Alberta

WHY APPLY?

Fort McKay is committed to the success of its employees and in addition to a competitive compensation structure, we also offer the following:

  • An employer matched Pension Plan
  • Comprehensive Health benefits package with Medical, Dental and Vision coverage
  • On-site Fitness Centre because a healthy work-life balance is important to us!
  • The opportunity to work with a community that is committed to protecting its traditional lands - to learn more about the Moose Lake Plan visit: http://www.mooselaketogether.ca

The New Elsie Fabian School Teachers will also receive;

  • The highest Teacher Salaries in the region (See 2021 Teacher Salaries Below)
  • Northern Living Allowance
  • Affordable Teacher Housing

HOW TO APPLY:

Follow this link and upload your Cover Letter and Resume in Microsoft Word or PDF:

ONLINE: https://fortmckayfirstnation2.applytojob.com/apply

Please indicate Competition #038-2021

Check us out on social media -> Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter & Instagram or www.fortmckay.com

Qualified candidates are invited to apply with a comprehensive resume detailing qualifications and experience as it relates to the position of interest. *Preference will be given to qualified applicants of Indigenous ancestry in any hiring decision, please declare your Indigenous status in your application.

title: newFrench Immersion Teacher - Replacement 100% (SOU-RE-109)
description:
Employment Opportunity:
French Immersion Teacher - Replacement 100% (SOU-RE-109)

South Hull Elementary School

Who We Are:
An English school board that is dedicated to developing lifelong learners who contribute to society and are prepared for their future. Teachers and staff are committed to academic excellence and the provision of quality education, which encourages social, emotional and moral development.

Key Responsibilities:
prepare and present courses and provide developmental and cognitive learning activities within the guidelines of the authorized programs;

work together with the other teachers and the personnel of the school in order to take the appropriate measures to meet the individual needs of students;

organize and supervise student activities;

provide support and remediation;

supervise students for whom he or she is responsible as well as other students in his or her presence;

evaluate the performance and progress of students for whom he or she is responsible and to report on them to the school administration and to parents according to the system in effect;

monitor the late arrivals and absences of his or her students and to report them to the school administration according to the system in effect;

participate in meetings relating to his or her work;

perform other duties usually assigned to teaching personnel;

choose the appropriate method to prepare and present his or her courses within the guidelines of the authorized programs;

take the necessary measures to enable him or her to attain and maintain a high level of professional competency in keeping with the Education Act;

provide learning and developmental activities to students and shall participate in the development of student life in the school.

Qualification Requirements:
Applicants must hold a "Brevet d'enseignement" or a teaching permit from the province of Quebec or from a Canadian province;

Teaching experience is considered an asset.

Application must include:
Resume (including detailed work history and education background)

A cover letter

Professional references

A valid security background check (if you possess one)

Please ensure your profile with Apply to Education is up to date.

Skills & Competencies:
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Ability to adapt to a variety of student needs

Superior organizational skills

APPLICATIONS MUST BE SUBMITTED THROUGH APPLYTOEDUCATION

https://westernquebec.ca/resources/careers/

Only those candidates chosen for interviews will be contacted.

The Western Quebec School Board is committed to building an educational community with the common purpose to realize the potential of all our students by cultivating a strong corps of support, professional, teaching and administrative excellence. We therefore encourage applications from Indigenous people, as well as from other racialized people groups, persons living with a disability, people of religious faith, and gender minorities.

As an organization, we strive to hire individuals who reflect the communities we serve, and who embody and practice a love of life-long learning, teamwork, and the highest professional ethics. Our efforts to achieve a diverse workforce that contributes to a culturally safe working environment include establishing proactive employment practices to address systemic barriers and removing obstacles to hiring and retaining qualified people.

The Western Québec School Board is required to implement Bill21

http://www.assnat.qc.ca/en/travaux-parlementaires/projets-loi/projet-loi-21-42-1.html

The Act respecting the laicity of the State (hereinafter the Act) has created an obligation for certain public organizations, including school boards, to ensure that religious symbols are not worn by specific employees while exercising their functions. The Act specifies that it is incumbent upon the Director General to take the necessary measures to ensure compliance with this new obligation.

The purpose of this Directive is to present the main obligations stemming from the Act and to guide management personnel in the implementation of any required measure, while respecting, as much as possible, the values of inclusion, integrity and respect as espoused by the Western Québec School Board.

The Act respecting the laicity of the State

Prohibition regarding the wearing of religious symbols

Principals, vice principals, centre directors, assistant centre directors, and teachers are prohibited from wearing religious symbols in the exercise of their functions.

title: English Teacher (Summer Camp - Elementary Level)
company: Ecole Internationale J. de la Fontaine
description:
Are you looking to join a dynamic school led by a team of dedicated professionals?

With branches in Pointe-Claire, Brossard, Laval and Lasalle, College International Jean de La Fontaine provides high quality English, French, Math, History, Art, Science and Chinese language instruction. Our school helps students to improve their grades, to stand out academically, and to secure future employment in the Canadian workforce.

Teachers at Jean de La Fontaine are passionate about education and dedicated to the success of their students. Taking the abilities and challenges of each child into consideration, our team values and excavates student talent, involving parents in their children’s learning process.

At Jean de La Fontaine, we are in constant pursuit of excellence, nurturing students’ enthusiasm for knowledge, and instilling them with positive values that will assist them in the present and in the future. Since our school’s establishment, more and more students achieve academic success by attending our courses.

We are looking for motivated English teachers who have a genuine desire to engage their students in the learning process and who enjoy working with a dynamic team.

-Teachers must be available to teach in person, over the summer, between June 27th and August 19th, 2022.

-Teachers must be able to travel to one or more of our four branches (Pointe-Claire, Laval, Lasalle, Brossard) to teach classes which will be scheduled between the hours of 9AM and 5PM on weekdays.

-New teachers will be provided with orientation materials, but will be expected to work independently and to prepare engaging lessons to complement provided textbooks.

- Throughout the summer camp, the teachers will work with several groups of elementary aged students to help them improve their grammar, vocabulary, and reading comprehension skills. Students may be at beginner, intermediate or advanced levels.

- The number of students in our group classes is limited as we encourage focused interactions between students and their teachers.

COVID-19 considerations:

Communication with supervisor in person and via telephone and email.

Job Types: Part-time, Freelance
Part-time hours: 10-15 per week

Salary: $30.00-$45.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Employees are expected to wear masks while teaching and working with colleagues. Hand sanitizer will be made available.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Pointe-Claire, QC H9R 0A2: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (required)

Experience:

  • teaching: 1 year (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 25% (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-04-14
Expected start date: 2022-06-13

title: Student Success Coordinator (Special Education Teacher)
description:
Job description

Do you want to join an innovative and progressive school that offers small class sizes and a supportive and team environment?

OneSchool is seeking a dynamic and creative Student Success Coordinator for our Stonewall Campus in Stonewall, MB. This candidate will work with students of all grades, using the Self Directed Learning model, to ensure our incredible students develop their full potential of “Learning To Learn”, while upholding Christian values and beliefs. Special Education qualifications are a requirement.

Requirements

  • Bachelor of Education (B.Ed) degree with eligibility or certifications from Manitoba
  • Recent criminal background check, including a vulnerable sector search (VSS)
  • Willingness to be part of a collaborative educational team;
  • Effective communication skills, both oral and written;
  • Professional learning community (PLC) knowledge and background preferred;
  • Evidence of sensitivity and respect for others and a willingness to work within cultural boundaries
  • Travel and valid passport required

History of Our School:

OneSchool North America, founded in 2005, is a school system of excellence, comprised of 36 private schools located across Canada, the United States, and the Caribbean. Currently, the system provides over 1,100 students aged 8-18 with an outstanding and challenging education, using the latest in technology and teaching pedagogy. Staff have the opportunity to travel and collaborate with like-minded professionals from across the continent. OneSchool is one of the world’s largest and most comprehensive, truly global schools. With nearly 10,000 students, over 130 campuses, and approximately 2,500 staff operating across 20 countries, OneSchool’s global education ecosystem provides an environment in which our staff and students thrive. Over 200 of these staff work in the U.S., Canada and the Caribbean in close cooperation, sharing best practice, professional learning opportunities and resources.

Salary is negotiable based on experience, skills, education and training.

Below are links with more information regarding our Schools and what we are all about. Also, below is a link to fill out referral information.

Referral: https://app.smartsheet.com/b/form/04daff99dd3b41458f5f9ef8389fdd45

Our Website: https://www.sterlinged.org/

Our Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/OneSchoolNACAR/

Our Twitter: https://twitter.com/oneschoolnacar?lang=en

Our LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/one-school-north-america/

OneSchool Global is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Job Type: Full-time

Application questions you have requested that Indeed ask candidates the following questions:

  • How many years of Teaching experience do you have?
  • What is the highest level of education you have completed?
  • Do you have the following license or certification: Manitoba Teaching License?
  • Do you have the following license or certification: Special Education?

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • What are you looking for as far as a salary range?
  • If offered a position, when would you be able to start?
  • Are you comfortable working for a private school as part of a global organization?
  • Do you hold any teaching licenses?
  • When are you available for a Zoom interview?

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Teaching: 1 year (preferred)

title: Registration Coordinator
description:
Job Summary

The Registration Coordinator will support our Program Manager and Program Coordinator in the administration of Free Play programming and day-to-day activities. This role requires a background in administration and experience providing frontline support to socially vulnerable youth, such as through social work, case work / mentorship programs.

Qualifications

  • Effective communication skills that enhance the ease of conversations with ESL families.
  • Experience with administration and communication support roles.
  • Social or nonprofit experience such as team leadership or youth case work experience would strongly be considered an asset.
  • Additional languages are an asset.
  • Representative of the community that Free Play serves.
  • Experience playing sport recreationally or competitively and understanding the power of sport as a tool for social good is considered an asset.
  • Standard First Aid Certification and CPR training.
  • Valid driver’s licence with no at fault accidents.
  • Clear Criminal and Vulnerable Sector check.
  • Proficiency with GSuite, Zoom and Microsoft Office software.

Responsibilities

  • Support the Program Manager and Program Coordinator with program administration support.
  • Calling parents regarding registration, program cancellations, program updates.
  • Building out Monthly Newsletters, Calendars, and Program Schedules to add to the Free Play for Kids website.
  • Supplies tracking and procurement, and communication and training coordination with team members.
  • Lead the Free Play registration process by ensuring key messaging is disseminated to community members and other potential participants, and follow up to ensure information is collected and managed accurately and efficiently.
  • Ensure program participants’ information is managed and distributed to various parts of the program such as registration lists, app, hardcopy lists, and emergency contact information.
  • Manage meaningful communication with program participants’ parents, guardians, teachers, group homes and other parties via a variety of channels such as phone, text and email.
  • Identify trends and develop best practices to address recurring challenges and incidents as they arise.
  • Elevate concerns related to large systemic problems to the Program Manager.
  • Running through sport practices and games and supporting coaches in the facilitation of activities

Additional responsibilities:

  • Oversight of registration and onboarding of kids including entering information, emergency contact info etc. into connecteam app.
  • Oversight on program attendance to ensure spots are filled to maximize meeting the needs of the community.

Skills & Knowledge

  • Servant leadership
  • Teamwork and collaboration
  • Service oriented
  • Strong oral and written communication
  • Adaptability and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Continuous learner
  • Reliability
  • Knowledge of Free Play for Kids is considered an asset
  • Experience with non-for-profit organization is considered an asset
  • Respect for / understanding of cultural diversity

Position Conditions

  • This is a part- time position, 25 hours per week

Free Play for Kids is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion are values of Free Play for Kids. Free Play for Kids welcomes applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Free Play for Kids respectfully operates on Treaty 6 territory, a traditional gathering place for diverse Indigenous peoples including the Cree, Blackfoot, Métis, Nakota Sioux, Iroquois, Dene, Ojibway/Saulteaux/Anishinaabe, Inuit, and many others whose histories, languages, and cultures continue to influence our community.

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 25 per week

Salary: $17.00-$20.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Employee assistance program
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: Classroom Teachers
description:
Location: Windsor Islamic High School, Windsor, ON

Status: Full-time/Part-time

Overview:

Windsor Islamic High School Windsor, Ontario seeks Ontario certified classroom teachers specialized in Science, Arts, English, French, Arabic and gym teacher to work within a professional learning community and who is able to lead within a diverse population of staff, students and families. We are looking for teachers with strong content knowledge, who can plan lessons with clear learning objectives that engage and inspire the students. We have a reputation for academic excellence. We offer small classes, competitive salaries, and a warm and supportive atmosphere.

Eligibility:

Candidate must be an Ontario Certified Teacher (OCT) and possess B. Ed. Degree or equivalent education and experience. The appropriate candidate should have a demonstrated history of proven success. This is demonstrated by the development and implementation of curriculum and academic programs which incorporate a holistic approach to education. This candidate will work in cooperation with school administration to ensure the school’s mission and vision are effectively implemented and the school meets changing student need and consistently exceeds all stakeholder expectations. Excellent communication, interpersonal and teaching skills are imperative. Candidate must be committed to Standards of Practice and Ethical Standards as outlined by the OCT. Knowledge of Islamic principles and their integrated teaching application is a key focus.

Other key areas of focus are:

Characteristics:

  • Dedication to instilling Islamic values and principles in a well-balanced educational approach
  • Commitment to creativity, innovation and integration
  • Uncompromising ethical standards
  • Passion for teaching and learning
  • Possess strong content knowledge, who can plan lessons with clear learning objectives that engage and inspire students
  • Commitment to professionalism and collaboration with staff, parents and students
  • Punctual, meticulous and reliable
  • Receptiveness to feedback and a desire to continuously improve
  • A strong sense of personal accountability for student achievement
  • A belief that all students should be held to high standards
  • A positive attitude and a drive for personal excellence
  • Outstanding instructional skills, including the ability to motivate and challenge students and maintain an orderly

If you have the right qualifications, we look forward to hearing from you!

How to Apply: Submit cover letter and resume to info@wihs.ca

Salary: Commensurate with experience and qualifications.

Starting Date: Flexible www.wihs.ca E-mail: info@wihs.ca, wihs@gmail.com

title: Science Teacher
description:
SA Institute is an educational center with a 11-year history in Montreal. We offer year-to-year government subsidized vocational training courses, as well as language training , extracurricular tutoring,a one-stop learning and immigrating services for candidates out of Canada. Due to development needs, we are looking for experienced teachers to join our team.

Job Title: Science Teacher(Teach in French)

Professional responsibilities:

· Teach Science to elementary and middle school students.

· Make teaching plans.

· Manage the class, prepare the lessons to be delivered to the students.

· Preparation and implementation of tests, exam papers and exercises.

· Score and provide appropriate feedback to students.

Job Skills:

· At least 1 years of experience in teaching math is recommended.

· Be familiar with primary and secondary school science curriculum system in Quebec.

· Education in elementary or secondary schools in Quebec is preferred.

· Fluent in French

· Good presentation and teaching skills.

· Be familiar with doing PPT and using the Zoom meeting system.

Part-time hours: 4-20 per week

Job Type: Part-time

Salary: From $18.00 per hour

Job Type: Part-time
Part-time hours: 4-20 per week

Salary: From $20.00 per hour

  • Weekend availability

title: Elementary Teacher
description:
Do you want to join an innovative and progressive school that offers small class sizes and a supportive and team environment?

OneSchool Global is seeking a dynamic and creative Elementary Teacher for our Stonewall Campus in Stonewall, MB. This candidate will primarily teach 5th and 6th grade classes using the Self Directed Learning model to ensure our incredible students develop their full potential with “Learning To Learn”, while upholding Christian values and beliefs.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor of Education
  • A valid teaching license for Manitoba
  • Willingness to take a criminal background check and drug screening
  • Willingness to be part of a collaborative educational team;
  • Effective communication skills, both oral and written;
  • Professional learning community (PLC) knowledge and background preferred;
  • Evidence of sensitivity and respect for others and a willingness to work within cultural boundaries
  • Travel and valid passport required

History of our School:

OneSchool North America, founded in 2005, is a school system of excellence, comprised of 38 private schools located across Canada, the United States, and the Caribbean. Currently, the system provides over 1,100 students aged 8-18 with an outstanding and challenging education, using the latest in technology and teaching pedagogy. Staff have the opportunity to travel and collaborate with like-minded professionals from across the continent. OneSchool is one of the world’s largest and most comprehensive, truly global schools. With nearly 10,000 students, over 130 campuses, and approximately 2,500 staff operating across 20 countries, OneSchool’s global education ecosystem provides an environment in which our staff and students thrive. Over 200 of these staff work in the U.S., Canada and the Caribbean in close cooperation, sharing best practice, professional learning opportunities and resources.

Salary is negotiable based on experience, skills, education and training.

title: newEnglish Teacher (Primary/High School)
company: Ecole Internationale J. de la Fontaine
description:
Are you looking to join a dynamic school led by a team of dedicated professionals?

With branches in Pointe-Claire, Brossard, Laval and Lasalle, College International Jean de La Fontaine provides high quality English, French, Math, History, Art, Science and Chinese language instruction. Our school helps students to improve their grades, to stand out academically, and to secure future employment in the Canadian workforce.

Teachers at Jean de La Fontaine are passionate about education and dedicated to the success of their students. Taking the abilities and challenges of each child into consideration, our team values and excavates student talent, involving parents in their children’s learning process.

At Jean de La Fontaine, we are in constant pursuit of excellence, nurturing students’ enthusiasm for knowledge, and instilling them with positive values that will assist them in the present and in the future. Since our school’s establishment, more and more students achieve academic success by attending our courses.

We are looking for motivated English teachers who have a genuine desire to engage their students in the learning process and who enjoy working with a dynamic team.

-Teacher must be available to teach in person, over the summer, between June 27th and August 19th, 2022. Prior to June 27th, course will be held online.

-During the summer, teacher must be able to travel to one or more of our four branches (Pointe-Claire, Laval, Lasalle, Brossard) to teach classes which will be scheduled between the hours of 9AM and 5PM on weekdays.

-New teachers will be provided with orientation materials, but will be expected to work independently and to prepare engaging lessons to complement provided textbooks.

- Students may be at beginner, intermediate or advanced levels.

- The number of students in our group classes is limited as we encourage focused interactions between students and their teachers.

COVID-19 considerations:

Communication with supervisor in person and via telephone and email.

Part-time hours: 10-15 per week

Salary: $25.00-$45.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Employees are expected to wear masks while teaching and working with colleagues. Hand sanitizer will be made available.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Pointe-Claire, QC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (required)

Experience:

  • teaching: 1 year (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 50% (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-14
Expected start date: 2022-05-06

title: newMiddle School Learning Resource Teacher - Part Time
description:
About us

Vancouver Christian School is a large, diverse K-12 school located in East Vancouver, British Columbia. A vibrant and close-knit community of over 800 students, VCS is a proud leader in Christian education celebrating 72 years of history in the region.

VCS is seeking a Middle School Resource Teacher with a minimum of 5 years of experience who can communicate effectively with staff, students, and parents. Resource teachers have a significant responsibility in helping children and adolescents develop the academic, behavioral, and social skills to fully grasp curriculum. They have the ability to modify teaching methods to target the unique needs of students with learning disabilities. Resource teachers support Tier 1 and Tier 2 in the MTSS model. Resource teachers will be able to assess student progress and be able to communicate that with all stakeholders. Resource teachers must attend regular professional development to learn new instructional strategies and be confident in coaching and mentoring teachers.

Main responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with classroom teachers to offer supports which can include various accommodations, adaptations, and modifications (i.e. push in and pull out)
  • Work alongside the Resource Teacher Coordinator and divisional Educational Support Services Coordinator; participate in the K-12 Resource Team
  • Support those with diverse learning needs with a focus on students with Q (Learning Disabilities) and/or P (Gifted) designations.
  • Develop and implement Learning Support Plans and Individualized Education Plans
  • Use best practices, learning interventions, and educational assessments to support student learning
  • Provide instructional coaching to classroom teachers within the classroom setting
  • Maintain clear and consistent communication with parents and students

Requirements

  • Are BC certified teachers; with the ability to care for the holistic growth of students and understand students for their potential
  • Have a minimum of five (5) years of classroom teaching experience or other relevant teaching experience and are familiar with the BC teaching curriculum
  • Aspiring resource teachers will need to take courses on their own accord to study adaptive curriculum, learning disabilities, instructional methods, and assistive technology
  • Are Christians, members of a Christian church, and committed to Christian Education
  • Think and work adaptively; with the ability to provide strategic input to teachers and families

Middle School Resource Teacher (6-8) Assets:

  • Have completed a graduate degree in Special Education, a Diploma in Special Education or at least three (3) relevant university-level courses in Special Education
  • Have a specialization in a core content area like English, Social Studies, Mathematics, or Sciences
  • Have at least 5 years teaching experience in a Middle School classroom
  • Adept in supporting students one-on-one or in small groups
  • Have a love for and understanding of how Middle School students learn and think

Application:

To express your interest in joining our team please provide us with the following documents:

  • Cover letter and full resume
  • Statement of faith
  • Transcripts from all relevant post-secondary education
  • Philosophy of Christian education

Reports/evaluations:

  • Recent graduates (up to two years of teaching experience) require final Practicum Reports
  • Experienced teachers (two or more years of teaching experience) require a recent (within the past 8 years) Teaching Evaluation Report (not lesson observations)

3 professional references-email and phone numbers

  • Recent graduates (up to two years of teaching experience) to include your Faculty Advisor, School Advisor(s) and one or more of the following: Principal, Vice Principal or most recent previous employer
  • Experienced teachers (two or more years of teaching experience) to include current Principal, Vice Principal and previous Administrator(s)

Please submit your application through https://vancs.org/Employment

While we appreciate your interest in Vancouver Christian School, only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

This posting will be available until position has been filled. Please visit our website www.vancs.org for further information about our school.

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 18.75 per week

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Licence/Certification:

  • BC Teaching Certificate (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-08-01

title: newElementary Teacher – Part Time 50% - Resource (POL-PT-89)
description:
Employment Opportunity:
Elementary Teacher - Part Time 50% - Resource (POL-PT-89)

Poltimore Elementary School

Who We Are:
An English school board that is dedicated to developing lifelong learners who contribute to society and are prepared for their future. Teachers and staff are committed to academic excellence and the provision of quality education, which encourages social, emotional and moral development.

Key Responsibilities:
prepare and present courses and provide developmental and cognitive learning activities within the guidelines of the authorized programs;

work together with the other teachers and the personnel of the school in order to take the appropriate measures to meet the individual needs of students;

organize and supervise student activities;

provide support and remediation;

supervise students for whom he or she is responsible as well as other students in his or her presence;

evaluate the performance and progress of students for whom he or she is responsible and to report on them to the school administration and to parents according to the system in effect;

monitor the late arrivals and absences of his or her students and to report them to the school administration according to the system in effect;

participate in meetings relating to his or her work;

perform other duties usually assigned to teaching personnel;

choose the appropriate method to prepare and present his or her courses within the guidelines of the authorized programs;

take the necessary measures to enable him or her to attain and maintain a high level of professional competency in keeping with the Education Act;

provide learning and developmental activities to students and shall participate in the development of student life in the school.

Qualification Requirements:
Applicants must hold a "Brevet d'enseignement" or a teaching permit from the province of Quebec or from a Canadian province;

Teaching experience is considered an asset.

Application must include:
Resume (including detailed work history and education background)

A cover letter

Professional references

A valid security background check (if you possess one)

Please ensure your profile with Apply to Education is up to date.

Skills & Competencies:
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Ability to adapt to a variety of student needs

Superior organizational skills

Work Conditions:
Start Date: March 7, 2022

End Date: June 29, 2022

APPLICATIONS MUST BE SUBMITTED THROUGH APPLYTOEDUCATION

https://westernquebec.ca/resources/careers/

Only those candidates chosen for interviews will be contacted.

The Western Quebec School Board is committed to building an educational community with the common purpose to realize the potential of all our students by cultivating a strong corps of support, professional, teaching and administrative excellence. We therefore encourage applications from Indigenous people, as well as from other racialized people groups, persons living with a disability, people of religious faith, and gender minorities.

As an organization, we strive to hire individuals who reflect the communities we serve, and who embody and practice a love of life-long learning, teamwork, and the highest professional ethics. Our efforts to achieve a diverse workforce that contributes to a culturally safe working environment include establishing proactive employment practices to address systemic barriers and removing obstacles to hiring and retaining qualified people.

The Western Québec School Board is required to implement Bill21

http://www.assnat.qc.ca/en/travaux-parlementaires/projets-loi/projet-loi-21-42-1.html

The Act respecting the laicity of the State (hereinafter the Act) has created an obligation for certain public organizations, including school boards, to ensure that religious symbols are not worn by specific employees while exercising their functions. The Act specifies that it is incumbent upon the Director General to take the necessary measures to ensure compliance with this new obligation.

The purpose of this Directive is to present the main obligations stemming from the Act and to guide

management personnel in the implementation of any required measure, while respecting, as much as

possible, the values of inclusion, integrity and respect as espoused by the Western Québec School Board.

The Act respecting the laicity of the State

Prohibition regarding the wearing of religious symbols

Principals, vice principals, centre directors, assistant centre directors, and teachers are prohibited from wearing religious symbols in the exercise of their functions.

title: Casa Teacher
description:
Full Time Position

Summary of Position

The Waterdown Montessori School teacher is responsible for providing a Montessori classroom/instructional program that supports the individual needs of the children in accordance with the School’s mission and vision. The Waterdown Montessori teacher creates a well-prepared environment and an atmosphere of learning and inquisitiveness designed to move students from one activity and level to the next. You will step back while the children are working, allowing them to learn from their own discoveries and draw their own conclusions. Rather than supplying children with answers, you will ask them how they would solve the problem, actively engaging children in the learning process and enhancing critical thinking skills.

Dr. Montessori believed that the teacher should focus on the child as a person rather than on the daily lesson plans. Although our Montessori teachers plan daily lessons for each child, s/he must be alert to changes in the child’s interest, progress, mood, and behavior.

Subjects are interwoven and you must have a general understanding of history, art, music, math, astronomy, chemistry, physical geography, language, physics, geometry, and practical life works. As one of our teachers, you will give one-on-one or small group lessons and spend little time giving large group lessons. Lessons are brief and precise, meant to intrigue the minds of children so that they come back to learn more on their own. Montessori lessons center around the most basic information necessary for the children to do the work: the name of the materials, where it can be found in the classroom and on the shelf, how to use the materials, and what can be done with them.

Teachers at Waterdown Montessori School are scientific observers of children. They avoid using rewards and punishments for good or poor work. You will never criticize or interfere in a child’s work and we recognize that it is only in a trusting atmosphere that a child’s personality has room to grow. Children must have the freedom to choose their own activities and learn to behave without restriction.


Essential Job Function

  • Develops lesson plans and manages the learning experiences for students to ensure the needs of the groups and individual students are met.
  • Assists students toward self-directed learning and normalization.
  • Maintains a neat, well organized, and attractive prepared environment consistent with Montessori pedagogy.
  • Participates in professional activities designated by the Head of School, which may include workshops, curriculum retreats, meetings, grade reporting, planning, and other professional pursuits.
  • Attends all pre-announced staff meetings and professional sessions, including staff, level, committee and, evening parent meetings.
  • Works to develop close and effective relationships with parents, including opportunities to discuss and understand the child’s individual progress; encourages them to bond with both the class and the larger school community; provides individualized tracking of student progress.
  • Participates in the admissions process, speaking from time to time with prospective families-at the request of the Head of School.
  • Follows the school’s policies and procedures for student evaluation and record keeping, meeting all due dates as required.

Weekly Tasks

  • Double check all learning materials
  • Remove all items that need repair replacement or cleaning and disinfecting
  • Rotate books
  • Note needed janitorial services, work orders
  • Restructure classroom routine as needed
  • Plan how to use volunteers, parents or “special resource people” for next week
  • Update personal notes
  • Meet with co-workers and Head of School to share ideas, plan and problem solve
  • Participate in staff meetings
  • Participate in parent education
  • Participate in professional meetings outside of school
  • Prepare for school’s community activities such as open houses, observation and all general meetings or special events

Related Duties

  • The teacher completes and maintains all records, reports, evaluations, and inventories of student records in a timely manner as may be required by the school.
  • The teacher is responsible for reading and adhering to the guidelines as established in the employee handbook and adhering to all school policies.
  • The teacher who works with assistants is responsible for the training and supervision of the assistant. The teacher is responsible for completing evaluations of assistants in accordance with school policy.

If you are AMI or MACTE certified and are interested in exploring a teaching opportunity with Waterdown Montessori School, then we encourage you to submit your resume.
